books.description: Nantucket residents are alarmed when a home, recently sold at an exorbitant price, goes up in flames and someone goes missing. Read by Erin Bennett and the author. 13 hours, 39 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SWAN SONG

books.author: Amy Tintera
books.description: A true crime podcast focusing on the unsolved murder of her friend forces Lucy to return to where it happened. Read by Will Damron and January LaVoy. 9 hours, 18 minutes unabridged.
books.title: LISTEN FOR THE LIE

books.author: Andy Weir
books.description: Ryland Grace awakes from a long sleep alone and far from home, and the fate of humanity rests on his shoulders. Read by Ray Porter. 16 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: PROJECT HAIL MARY

books.author: Jonathan Haidt
books.description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children. Read by Sean Pratt and the author. 10 hours, 33 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION

books.author: Anthony S. Fauci
books.description: The physician-scientist and immunologist chronicles his six decades of public service, including his work during the AIDS crisis and the Covid-19 pandemic. Read by the author. 19 hours, 13 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ON CALL

books.author: Erik Larson
books.description: A portrayal of the months between the election of Abraham Lincoln and the beginning of the Civil War. Read by Will Patton and the author. 17 hours, 19 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE DEMON OF UNREST

books.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity. Read by Peter Attia. 17 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OUTLIVE

books.author: Bill Maher
books.description: The host of “Real Time With Bill Maher” gives his take on a variety of subjects in American culture and politics. Read by the author. 12 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WHAT THIS COMEDIAN SAID WILL SHOCK YOU

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother. Read by the author. 6 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
books.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: Tom O'Neill with Dan Piepenbring
books.contributor: by Tom O'Neill with Dan Piepenbring
books.description: A reassessment of events surrounding the murders committed by Charles Manson’s followers. Read by Kevin Stillwell. 16 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: CHAOS

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Pete Hegseth
books.description: The "Fox & Friends Weekend" host shares his experiences serving in the Army and his views on the current state of the American military. Read by the author. 8 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE WAR ON WARRIORS

books.author: Whoopi Goldberg
books.description: The EGOT winner shares personal stories about her mother and older brother and the struggles they faced. Read by the author. 6 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BITS AND PIECES

books.author: Griffin Dunne
books.description: The actor and director mixes stories from his family with tales of celebrities. Read by the author. 12 hours, 19 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE FRIDAY AFTERNOON CLUB

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: David Grann
books.description: The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events. Read by Dion Graham and the author. 8 hours, 28 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE WAGER

books.author: Michael Richards
books.description: The comedic actor, known for his role as Kramer on “Seinfeld,” shares insights on physical comedy and moments from his life. Read by the author. 15 hours, 14 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ENTRANCES AND EXITS

books.author: Rick Rubin with Neil Strauss
books.contributor: by Rick Rubin with Neil Strauss
books.title: THE CREATIVE ACT

books.author: Ramit Sethi
books.title: I WILL TEACH YOU TO BE RICH, SECOND EDITION

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The 12th book in the Dog Man series. Dog Man finds himself back on his hind legs after being sprayed by a skunk.
books.title: THE SCARLET SHEDDER

books.author: Kohei Horikoshi
books.description: All for One’s new form seems invincible and only one hero can keep him from getting to Tomura.
books.title: MY HERO ACADEMIA, VOL. 38

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The 11th book in the Dog Man series. Piggy returns and the Supa Buddies are sabotaged.
books.title: TWENTY THOUSAND FLEAS UNDER THE SEA

books.author: Ann M. Martin.
books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Katy Farina
books.description: The eighth book in the Baby-Sitters Little Sister series. A fight and an unfun new girl could sour a sleepover.
books.title: KAREN'S SLEEPOVER

books.author: Naoya Matsumoto
books.description: Hoshina goes into battle with a new weapon and Kafka finds himself in a difficult situation.
books.title: KAIJU NO. 8, VOL. 10

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The fifth book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. As publication seems possible, the baby frogs feel doubt.
books.title: INFLUENCERS

books.author: Ann M. Martin.
books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Arley Nopra
books.description: The 15th book in the Baby-Sitters Club graphic novel series. Things escalate when a practical joker causes Claudia to break her leg.
books.title: CLAUDIA AND THE BAD JOKE

books.author: Kentaro Miura
books.description: A swordsman teams up with the leader of a mercenary band to fight evil forces; collects the first three issues of the manga series.
books.title: BERSERK DELUXE, VOL. 1

books.author: Gege Akutami
books.description: A cursed spirit threatens to put Maki and Noritoshi in danger.
books.title: JUJUTSU KAISEN, VOL. 22

books.author: Tui T. Sutherland.
books.contributor: by Tui T. Sutherland. Illustrated by Mike Holmes
books.description: The seventh book in the Wings of Fire graphic novel series. Winter must face his family in the Ice Kingdom.
books.title: WINTER TURNING

books.author: Tatsuki Fujimoto
books.description: The appearance of a primal fear devil may make working together difficult for Asa and Yoru.
books.title: CHAINSAW MAN, VOL. 15

books.author: Tui T. Sutherland.
books.contributor: by Tui T. Sutherland. Illustrated by Mike Holmes
books.description: The first book in the Wings of Fire graphic book series. Five dragonets spring into action to fulfill their destiny.
books.title: THE DRAGONET PROPHECY

books.author: Francine Pascal.
books.contributor: by Francine Pascal. Illustrated by Knack Whittle
books.description: The fourth book in the Sweet Valley Twins graphic novel series. Troubles develop when a new girl moves into the town’s haunted house. Adapted by Nicole Andelfinger.
books.title: THE HAUNTED HOUSE

books.author: Lauren Tarshis.
books.contributor: by Lauren Tarshis. Illustrated by Brian Churilla
books.description: Paul Colbert uncovers a secret resistance movement; adapted into a graphic novel by Georgia Ball.
books.title: I SURVIVED THE BATTLE OF D-DAY, 1944

books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The seventh book in the Dog Man series. A new villain has a bone to pick with Dog Man while Petey the Cat starts a new life.
books.title: FOR WHOM THE BALL ROLLS

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: A best-selling author inherits an estate near London from her uncle and contemplates embracing a new identity.
books.title: HAPPINESS

books.author: David Baldacci
books.description: When his ex-girlfriend turns up dead in his office building, an entry-level investment analyst delves into the halls of economic power.
books.title: THE 6:20 MAN

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: A search for stolen rare manuscripts leads to a Florida island.
books.title: CAMINO ISLAND

books.author: James Patterson
books.description: Detective Alex Cross and the true-crime author Thomas Tull search for a serial killer known as the Family Man.
books.title: TRIPLE CROSS

books.author: James Rollins
books.description: The 17th book in the Sigma Force series. After a geological disaster, Cmdr. Gray Pierce and his team go into action to prevent even greater threats.
books.title: TIDES OF FIRE

books.author: John Sandford
books.description: The second book in the Letty Davenport series. Letty takes an undercover assignment that puts her in harm’s way with a group of hackers.
books.title: DARK ANGEL

books.author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.contributor: by William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.description: The second book in the Frontier Overland Company series. Butch and Cobb might be making their final stagecoach trip.
books.title: DRY ROAD TO NOWHERE

books.author: Fern Michaels
books.description: A rising chef suffers a sudden and mysterious illness that brings up questions from his family’s past.
books.title: ON THE LINE

books.author: Sandra Brown
books.description: The TV journalist Kerra Bailey and former federal agent John Trapper join forces to expose a web of conspiracy behind a hotel bombing in Dallas.
books.title: SEEING RED

books.author: RaeAnne Thayne
books.description: The fifth book in the Cape Sanctuary series. Meredith becomes interested in the writer who is renting a cottage next door.
books.title: THE CAFE AT BEACH END

books.author: James Patterson and Adam Hamdy
books.contributor: by James Patterson and Adam Hamdy
books.description: The 15th book in the Private series. A murder in Moscow appears to be linked to one that happened inside the New York Stock Exchange.
books.title: PRIVATE MOSCOW

books.author: Brad Thor
books.description: The 22nd book in the Scot Harvath series. When American aid workers are killed amid other atrocities in Ukraine, America’s top spy is sent to set things right.
books.title: DEAD FALL

books.author: Michael Connelly
books.description: Ballard and Bosch bury old resentments as they go after two killers.
books.title: DESERT STAR

books.author: Ruth Ware
books.description: A decade after her first year at Oxford, an expectant mother looks into the mystery of her former best friend’s death.
books.title: THE IT GIRL

books.author: Lucy Foley
books.description: Jess has suspicions about her half-brother’s eclectic and unfriendly neighbors when he goes missing.
books.title: THE PARIS APARTMENT

books.author: Jordan Lees.
books.contributor: by Jordan Lees. Illustrated by Vivienne To
books.title: THE LABYRINTH OF LOST AND FOUND

books.author: Rosanne Parry.
books.contributor: by Rosanne Parry. Illustrated by Mónica Armiño
books.title: A WOLF CALLED WANDER

books.author: William Kamkwamba and Bryan Mealer.
books.contributor: William Kamkwamba and Bryan Mealer. Illustrated by Anna Hymas
books.title: THE BOY WHO HARNESSED THE WIND

books.author: Rosanne Parry.
books.contributor: by Rosanne Parry. Illustrated by Lindsay Moore
books.title: A WHALE OF THE WILD

books.title: IF ONLY I HAD TOLD HER
